intro: Ouratea verruculosa, commonly known as the warty ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive warty or knobby fruits. The plant typically grows as an understory tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly waxy texture. The flowers are small, white or pale green, and are borne in clusters, adding to its ornamental value in cultivation.
